alert.note: Alert for Apache; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 09 at 4:17PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR AREAS BETWEEN HOLBROOK AND TAYLOR... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Areas between Holbrook and Taylor in a portion of Apache and Navajo counties * WHEN...Until 630 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. Ponding of water on highways will create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 415 PM MST, doppler radar indicated additional heavy rainfall moving into the advisory area. Minor flooding has already been reported between Holbrook and Taylor. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Scott Wash, Sevenmile Draw, East Washboard Wash, Little Colorado River, Cottonwood Wash, Fivemile Wash, Washboard Wash, Little Milky Wash, Concho Flat Wash, Hay Hollow Draw, Phoenix Park Wash, Carr Lake Draw, Oso Draw, Silver Creek and Cheney Draw. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Taylor, Woodruff, Twin Lake and Snowflake. - This includes the following highways... State Route 277 near mile marker 336. State Route 77 between mile markers 357 and 385. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. Low water crossings will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
